title: Joe investigates how vigorously the Group 2 elements react with water. He wants to find out if there is trend in these reactions. How can I name the variable he changes and the variable he observes? - Quora

response.answer_text: You can name the variables the same way you name anything… name them Bob and Alice if you like. Just design the experiment. What he is observing is the vigor of the reactions with water … how would you normally tell if one reaction was more or less vigorous than another? What do you normally call that? What he is changing is the element in group II being tested. So when you change elements in group II, what are you changing? (Look on a periodic table to see.)
The variables to change are temperature and concentration. The variables to observe are temperature change and reaction rate. For reactions in water, pressure is normally not involved.
